segments.text: I notice the little boy standing on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so high, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless he’s being, but he’s just a kid, after all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him is waiting with her hand out, like she’s expecting a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re both so focused on those cookies that they don’t even see the water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they know their mom is right there, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is already tilting, and the floor is wet—this is a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don’t get hurt, but they’re really pushing their luck.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should probably warn them, but I don’t want to ruin their fun.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments where you just hold your breath and hope for the best.
segments.speaker: PAR
